Description: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HELP BUILD THE TRIBE'S CAPACITY TO ASSESS AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS AND TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES.  THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING AIR EMISSIONS, RULEMAKING, AND OTHER PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE TRIBE'S AIR QUALITY.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $84,000.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD THE TRIBE'S CAPACITY TO ASSESS AIR QUALITY CONDITIONS AND TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING AIR EMISSIONS, RULEMAKING, AND OTHER PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE TRIBE'S AIR QUALITY. 

THIS GRANT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $80,855.


ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 103 PROGRAM INCLUDING: STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING RESERVATION-WIDE AIR EMISSIONS, DEVELOPING AN AIR REGULATORY PROGRAM, PROVIDING COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, AND PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL INITIATIVES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. THESE ACTIVITIES SUPPORT THE TRIBE'S GOAL TO PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE COLLECTING AIR QUALITY DATA AND SUBMITTING RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BROADENED AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND ESTABLISH PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THE ATTAINMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS   (NAAQS) AS WELL AS IMMEDIATE AND EMERGING THREATS TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND WELFARE FROM AIR POLLUTION. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE COLORADO RIVER INDIAN TRIBE AREA RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE DECREASED EXPOSURE TO CRITERIA AND HAZARDOUS AIR POLLUTANTS.

THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING AIR EMISSIONS, RULEMAKING, AND OTHER PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE TRIBE'S AIR QUALITY. ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 103 PROGRAM INCLUDING: STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION, COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, MONITORING RESERVATION-WIDE AIR EMISSIONS, DEVELOPING AN AIR REGULATORY PROGRAM, PROVIDING COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, AND PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL INITIATIVES TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE COLLECTING AIR QUALITY DATA AND SUBMITTING RESULTS TO EPA'S NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE SOUTHERN UTE INDIAN TRIBE IN ITS EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT AIR POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE SOUTHERN UTE RESERVATION AND AIRSHED, INCLUDING CONTINUING DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STATIONARY SOURCE REGULATIONSAND CONTINUING PROMULGATION AND UPDATE OF ENHANCED MOBILE SOURCE REGULATIONSAND IMPROVEMENT OF EMISSION INVENTORIES FOR MODELING SIMULATIONSAND OPERATING AN AIR MONITORING NETWORKAND AND OTHER AIR PLANNING ACTIVITIES. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE PUBLICS AIR QUALITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO MONITOR AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY ON THE SOUTHERN UTE RESERVATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE DEVELOPING AN AIR QUALITY EMISSIONS INVENTORY, MONITORING AIR QUALITY, ATTENDING ENVIRONMENTALLY RELATED TRAINING AND MEETINGS, CREATING A QUALITY ASSURANCE DOCUMENT, AND CONDUCTING ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA, THE APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT OF EPA FUNDING, AND MEASURES TO IMPROVE AND PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE CITIZENS AND RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTHERN UTE RESERVATION. NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE ANTICIPATED AT THE TIME OF THE AWARD.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE MESKWAKI TRIBE TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES AS OUTLINED IN CAA 103. THIS PROJECT RE-STARTS THEIR AMBIENT AIR MONITORING PROGRAM, AND CONTINUES TRAINING OF ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF IN INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR SUBJECTS, PUBLIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, ALL WITH GOAL OF IMPROVING AND PROTECTING THE HEALTH OF MESKWAKI TRIBAL NATION.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TRAINING IN INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY CONCERNS, THE DEVELOPMENT OF A QAPP AND SUBSEQUENT INSTALLATION OF A METSTATION, AS WELL AS PUBLIC OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS TO BOLSTER COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE SUCCESSFUL INSTALLATION OF METSTATION, APPROVED QAPP, SUBMISSION OF ACCURATELY COLLECTED DATA. STAFF EDUCATION AND PUBLIC OUTREACH WILL EDUCATE THE CITIZENRY OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES FACING THE TRIBAL POPULATION, AS WELL AS CONTRIBUTE TO GENERAL KNOWLEDGE REGARDING AIR QUALITY. EDUCATION WILL INCREASE COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF AIR ISSUES AND ASSIST IN AVOIDING NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES RELATED TO ADVERSE AIR QUALITY EVENTS. BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE INHABITANTS OF THE MESKWAKI TRIBE AND THE PUBLIC AT LARGE. THERE ARE NO KNOWN SUBRECIPIENTS AT THIS TIME.

ALSO INCLUDED ARE OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS TO BOLSTER COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES. AS WELL AS ENERGY CONSUMPTION EDUCATION AIMED AT IMPROVING ENERGY EFFICIENCY WITHIN TRIBAL HOMES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT ASSISTS THE TRIBE IN UNDERSTANDING THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES FACING THE TRIBAL POPULATION, AS WELL AS CONTRIBUTES TO GENERAL KNOWLEDGE REGARDING INDOOR AND AMBIENT AIR. BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE INHABITANTS OF THE PONCA TRIBE OF NEBRASKA. THERE ARE NO KNOWN SUBRECIPIENTS AT THIS TIME.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE WINNEBAGO TRIBE OF NEBRASKA TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES AS OUTLINED IN CAA 103. THIS PROJECT CONTINUES AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT EFFORTS WITH THE GOAL OF IMPROVING AND PROTECTING THE HEALTH OF THE WINNEBAGO TRIBE. CONTINUED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MERCURY MONITORING, WITH THIS NEW PROJECT DEPLOYING A METONE METROLOGIC STATION FOR INCREASED AMBIENT AIR MONITORING CAPABILITIES. ALSO INCLUDED ARE OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS TO BOLSTER COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF INDOOR AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THIS PROJECT ASSISTS THE TRIBE IN UNDERSTANDING LOCAL AIR QUALITY ISSUES AS WELL AS CONTRIBUTES DATA TO NATIONAL MONITORING DATABASES. EDUCATION WILL INCREASE COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF AIR ISSUES AND ASSIST IN IMPROVING AND AVOIDING NEGATIVE HEALTH OUTCOMES RELATED TO ADVERSE AIR QUALITY EVENTS. BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE WINNEBAGO TRIBAL POPULATION AND USERS OF COLLECTED METEOROLOGICAL DATA. THERE ARE NO KNOWN SUBRECIPIENTS AT THIS TIME.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF METEOROLOGICAL STATION, PM2.5 MONITOR, AND MERCURY WET DEPOSITION STATION WITH SUBSEQUENT DATA COLLECTION. OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE TRAVEL AND PARTICIPATION IN NATIONAL AIR QUALITY CONFERENCES AND EDUCATION EVENTS, AS WELL AS COMMUNITY OUTREACH (NEWSLETTERS, SOCIAL MEDIA) USING COLLECTED DATA TO INFORM TRIBE OF TRENDS AND THREATS, AND OVERALL AIR QUALITY, AS WELL AS IN PERSON EVENTS ON EARTH DAY AND OTHER EVENTS.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUALITY ASSURED DATA FROM THE METROLOGIC, PARTICULATE MATTER, AND MERCURY WET DEPOSITION STATIONS, AS WELL AS DERIVED NARRATIVE REPORTS FIT FOR LAY COMMUNITY CONSUMPTION. OUTCOMES ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS ARE AWARENESS AND EDUCATION OF TRENDS, THREATS, AND IMPROVEMENTS IN AMBIENT AIR QUALITY. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE WINNEBAGO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE SAULT SAINTE MARIE TRIBE OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS IN ITS EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT AIR QUALITY PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE TRIBAL LANDS.
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT SECTION 103 PROGRAM, INCLUDING: 1) BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS A WIDE RANGE OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES, 2) REVIEW AND COMMENT ON AIR QUALITY PERMITS THAT MAY AFFECT THE TRIBE, 3) IMPLEMENT AN INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND EDUCATION PROGRAM, 4) OPERATE A NATIONAL TRENDS NETWORK SITE 5) CARRY OUT AN OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH IMPACTS, AND 6) DEVELOP AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY FOR TRIBAL LANDS.
OUTCOMES:
OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES, AND IMPROVED AIR QUALITY ON TRIBAL LANDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE TRIBAL RESIDENTS, WHO WILL HAVE IMPROVED AIR QUALITY AND REDUCED LOCALIZED POLLUTION. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER SECTION 103 OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) TO THE HO-CHUNK NATION OF WISCONSIN (HCN) TO EXPAND ITS EXPERTISE AND MONITORING CAPABILITIES FOR THEIR AIR QUALITY PROGRAM.
ACTIVITIES:
HCN WILL OBTAIN TRAINING FOR THE AIR QUALITY SPECIALIST ON ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND AIR MONITORING SOFTWARE. HCN WILL ALSO PERFORM INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENT FOR ITS RESIDENTS AS WELL AS CONDUCT TWO OUTREACH SESSIONS. HCN WILL REVIEW COMMENTS ITS TREATMENT AS A STATE (TAS) APPLICATION AND SUBMIT A FINISHED CAA SECTION 105 WORKPLAN, AND CONTINUE THE OPERATION OF ITS TWO PARTICULATE MATTER (PM) AIR MONITORING STATIONS.
OUTCOMES:
EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED EXPERTISE AND KNOWLEDGE OF AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT OF THE AIR QUALITY SPECIALIST, IMPROVEMENT IN INDOOR AIR QUALITY AMONG TRIBAL CITIZENS, INCREASED CAPACITY OF THE TRIBAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM, AND EXPAND THE KNOWLEDGE OF PARTICULATE MATTER (PM) POLLUTION IN HO-CHUNK NATION. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TRIBAL MEMBERS OF HO-CHUNK NATION.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THE SAULT STE. MARIE TRIBE OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO CHARACTERIZE AND ADDRESS AIR QUALITY CONCERNS ON THEIR RESERVATION. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE AIR QUALITY TRAINING, AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, REVIEW OF AIR PERMITS FOR SOURCES POTENTIALLY AFFECTING AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION, OPERATION OF A NATIONAL TRENDS NETWORK SITE, AND CREATING PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY THROUGH OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. FURTHER, THE TRIBE WILL EXPLORE FEASIBILITY OF APPLYING FOR SECTION 105 CLEAN AIR ACT AUTHORITIES AND WILL ASSESS THE NEED FOR AIR MONITORING ON THE RESERVATION THROUGH THE DRAFT OF AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY AND RESEARCH INTO THE POTENTIAL IMPACTS OF A PLANNED FERROCHROME PROCESSING PLANT.

HO-CHUNK NATION WILL EXPAND EXPERTISE AND MONITORING CAPABILITIES FOR THE AIR QUALITY PROGRAM. THE AIR QUALITY SPECIALIST WILL EXPAND THEIR EXPERTISE THROUGH TARGETED TRAINING, MEETINGS, AND NATIONAL SEMINARS. HO-CHUNK NATION WILL PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS, AS WELL AS PERFORM AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, SUBMIT AN ELIGIBILITY APPLICATION FOR CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) SECTIONS 105 AND 505(A)(2) UNDER THE CAA TRIBAL AUTHORITY RULE, AND CONTINUE THE OPERATION OF TWO PARTICULATE MATTER MONITORS ON THE HO-CHUNK NATION RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:

ACTIVITIES:
THE ACTIVITIES KBIC WILL IMPLEMENT INCLUDE BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING AN AIR QUALITY SENSOR MONITORING PROGRAM.
OUTCOMES:
OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES, OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY DATA ON TRIBAL LANDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE TRIBAL RESIDENTS, STUDENTS, COMMUNITY, AND LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL GROUPS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE FORT SILL APACHE TRIBE IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS ON THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING TRIBAL LANDS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, CONDUCT PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 AIR MONITORING, PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, AND PRESENT AMBIENT AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY INFORMATION THROUGH EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 103 AUTHORITY INCLUDING: 1) TO SUPPORT THE TRIBAL AIR STAFF'S CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT THROUGH TRAINING, 2) CONDUCT PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 AIR MONITORING, 3) UPDATE EMISSIONS INVENTORY, AND 4) PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON AMBIENT AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY IN THE COMMUNITY.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE CONDUCTING PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 AIR MONITORING, UPDATING THE EMISSIONS INVENTORY, PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, AND AMBIENT AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, OBTAIN PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 AIR MONITORING DATA FOR COMPARISON TO THE NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS, ESTABLISHED WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, AND RAISE AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE FORT SILL APACHE TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE UNITED KEETOOWAH BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS ON THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING TRIBAL LANDS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, UTILIZE AIR MONITORING PLAN TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE AIR POLLUTANT EQUIPMENT AND LOCATION SITE, PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 103 AUTHORITY INCLUDING: 1) TO SUPPORT THE TRIBAL AIR STAFF'S CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT THROUGH TRAINING, 2) DETERMINE LOGISTICAL NEEDS TO CONDUCT AN AMBIENT AIR QUALITY MONITORING, 3) CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS ON RESIDENTIAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS, AND 4) PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF AN AIR MONITORING SITE-LOCATION PLAN, REPORTS FOR INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS ON TWO RESIDENTIAL HOMES AND ONE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT BUILDING, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, UTILIZE AN AIR MONITORING PLAN TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE AIR POLLUTANT EQUIPMENT AND LOCATION SITE(S), ABILITY TO NETWORK WITH OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND RAISE AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE UNITED KEETOOWAH BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE PUEBLO OF TESUQUE IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS ON THE PUEBLO'S RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING PUEBLO LANDS IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE PUEBLO TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, INCREASE TRIBAL AIR STAFF'S KNOWLEDGE OF EMISSIONS INVENTORY DEVELOPMENT, AND ESTABLISH A NETWORK WITH OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS, REGIONALLY AND NATIONALLY.

THE TRIBE'S DAYCARE AND PRE-SCHOOL STAFF WILL BE TRAINED ON MAINTAINING HEALTHY AIR QUALITY IN THE CLASSROOM. UTILIZING THE TRIBE'S INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENT QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP), KBIC WILL COMPLETE HOME ASSESSMENTS OF THREATS TO CITIZENS' HEALTH.

DESCRIPTION:
THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE POACH BAND OF CREEK INDIANS(PBCI) IN THE AMOUNT OF $27,218 IN FUNDING IN SUPPORT OF THE TRIBE'S EFFORTS TO CONTINUE BUILDING CAPACITY TO ESTABLISH A TRIBAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM THAT MEETS THE NEEDS OF THE TRIBE AND IS PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS GRANT IS TO 1) CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY(IAQ) BUILDING WALK-THROUGHS TO ESTABLISH A BASELINE AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS ON ADDRESSING IAQ ISSUES ; 2) CONTINUE TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN THE METEOROLOGICAL (MET) STATION TO COLLECT DATA TO POTENTIALLY BE USED IN AIR QUALITY DATA ANALYSIS, AND TO HELP PBCI OFFICES/DEPARTMENTS WITH THEIR WEATHER DATA NEEDS ; 3) COLLABORATE WITH THE TRIBAL HOUSING AUTHORITY TO PROVIDE ENERGY EFFICIENCY INFORMATION AND OUTREACH TO TRIBAL MEMBERS; AND 4) ATTEND NATIONAL AND REGIONAL TRAINING EVENTS TO OBTAIN KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO ADMINISTER AND EXPAND THE TRIBAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM.

ACTIVITIES:
ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RECIPIENT WILL COLLECT QUALITY ASSURED METEOROLOGICAL DATA FOR PBCI DEPARTMENT/OFFICE USE AND SUBMIT RESULTS TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S (EPA'S) NATIONAL AIR QUALITY DATABASE; CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY BUILDING WALK-THROUGHS TO ESTABLISH A BASELINE AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS ON ADDRESSING IAQ ISSUES; COLLABORATE WITH THE TRIBAL HOUSING AUTHORITY TO PROVIDE ENERGY EFFICIENCY INFORMATION AND OUTREACH TO TRIBAL MEMBERS; AND ATTEND NATIONAL AND REGIONAL TRAINING EVENTS TO OBTAIN KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO ADMINISTER AND EXPAND THE TRIBAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM.
OUTCOMES:
EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ANTICIPATED SHORT-TERM OUTCOME FOR THIS PROJECT IS AN INCREASE IN THE KNOWLEDGE OF TRIBAL MEMBERS REGARDING AIR QUALITY, AND THE BENEFITS OF IMPROVING ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY AS IT RELATES TO HAVING A HEALTHY HOME. THE LONG-TERM OUTCOME, THROUGH ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING IS TO ENSURE THAT THE NEEDS OF THE TRIBE ARE MET BY ESTABLISHING A TRIBAL AIR QUALITY PROGRAM WHICH IS PROTECTIVE OF HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE THE PBCI TRIBAL MEMBERS LOCATED IN ATMORE, ALABAMA. 
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS ON THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING TRIBAL LANDS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL CONDUCT AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY, CONDUCT A BASIC AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENT TO DETERMINE AIR MONITORING NEEDS, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE CHEYENNE ARAPAHO TRIBE TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COLLECTING PHYSICAL AND WATER QUALITY DATA (FOUR FUNDAMENTAL REPORTING PARAMETERS) AT A TOTAL OF 11 MONITORING SITES.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE RED CLIFF BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA IN ITS EFFORTS TO IMPLEMENT AIR QUALITY PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT TRIBAL LANDS.
ACTIVITIES:
THE RECIPIENT WILL IMPLEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT SECTION 103 PROGRAM, INCLUDING: 1) BUILD TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS A WIDE RANGE OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES, 2) IMPLEMENT AN INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND EDUCATION PROGRAM,  3) CARRY OUT AN OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH IMPACTS, AND 4) DEVELOP AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY FOR TRIBAL LANDS.
OUTCOMES:
OUTCOMES INCLUDE INCREASED TRIBAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND IMPROVED AIR QUALITY ON TRIBAL LANDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE TRIBAL RESIDENTS, WHO WILL HAVE IMPROVED AIR QUALITY AND REDUCED LOCALIZED POLLUTION.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THE TRIBE WILL DEVELOP A DATABASE OF TRIBAL DIESEL VEHICLES, AND A BOARD PROPOSAL FOR THE DIESEL EMISSION AND REDUCTION ACT PROGRAM.  THEY WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH THE INTER-TRIBAL COUNCIL OF MICHIGAN WITH THEIR AIR MONITORING PROGRAM TO ASSIST IN THE INTERPRETATION OF AIR QUALITY DATA.  THE TRIBE WILL DEVELOP A WOODSTOVE ASSESSMENT PROGRAM AND INVESTIGATE THE USE OF COOKING OIL FOR AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM FIELD VEHICLE.  THEY WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT AN OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES.

IN ADDITION, THE AIR QUALITY SPECIALIST WILL REVIEW AND UPDATE THE MINOR/MAJOR SOURCE DATABASE AND OPERATE TWO PARTICULATE MATTER MONITORS ON THE RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THE LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS (LRBOI) WILL COLLECT AND ANALYZE PARTICULATE MATTER AND OZONE DATA TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS AND POLLUTANT TRANSPORT ACROSS LAKE MICHIGAN, ATTEND TRAININGS TO BOLSTER THE TRIBE'S AIR PROGRAM, AND INFORM TRIBAL MEMBERS OF AIR RELATED ISSUES.ACTIVITIES:OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MANAGING, REVIEWING, AND REVISING THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY (IAQ) PROGRAM; TITLE V PERMIT REVIEW; TRAINING, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH; PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORKGROUPS; IAQ BASELINE ASSESSMENTS TO BEGIN AN IAQ PROGRAM; EMISSIONS INVENTORIES (EI) UPDATES; NATIONAL EMISSIONS INVENTORIES REVIEW WITH THE INSTITUTE FOR TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS; ESTABLISHING BASELINES FOR CLIMATE RESILIENCY; PEP/NPAP AUDITS AS WELL AS UPDATING THE TRIBAL RESERVATION AREA SPECIFIC EMISSION INVENTORIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:LRBOI ANTICIPATES THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES: TRAINING OF PERSONNEL IN THE TRIBE'S AIR PROGRAM, AIR PERMIT REVIEWS, CONTINUED MONITORING OF OZONE AND PM 2.5 FOR NATIONAL AMBIENT AIR QUALITY STANDARDS (NAAQS) COMPARISON, EDUCATIONAL AND OUTREACH MATERIALS GENERATED FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS, DEVELOPMENT OF AN EI AND REMOTE SENSOR QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN, AND BASELINE ASSESSMENTS FOR IAQ PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT. THE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF LRBOI'S AIR PROGRAM THROUGH THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT TRIBAL MEMBERS BY ENHANCING THE FRAMEWORK OF AIR PROJECTS PRODUCED UNDER PREVIOUS GRANTS.

THE LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS (LRBOI) WILL COLLECT AND ANALYZE PARTICULATE MATTER AND OZONE DATA USED TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS AND POLLUTANT TRANSPORT ACROSS LAKE MICHIGAN. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MANAGING THE AIR QUALITY PROGRAM, TITLE V PERMIT REVIEW, TRAINING, EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORKGROUPS, INDOOR AIR QUALITY SUPPLIES, EMISSIONS INVENTORIES UPDATES, NATIONAL EMISSIONS INVENTORIES REVIEW WITH THE INSTITUTE FOR TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS, AND PEP/NPAP AUDITS AS WELL AS UPDATING THE TRIBAL RESERVATION AREA SPECIFIC EMISSION INVENTORIES, AND REVIEW AND REVISING THE INDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM.

THE LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS (LRBOI) WILL COLLECT AND ANALYZE OZONE DATA USED TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS AND POLLUTANT TRANSPORT ACROSS LAKE MICHIGAN. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER TRIBAL, STATE AND FEDERAL AIR PROFESSIONALS, REVIEWING TITLE V AIR PERMITS AND CONDUCTING AIR QUALITY INVESTIGATIONS AND EDUCATION AND OUTREACH WITHIN THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY.

LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS (LRBOI) WILL COLLECT AND ANALYZE OZONE AND PM DATA USED TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS AND POLLUTANT TRANSPORT ACROSS LAKE MICHIGAN. OTHER ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE BUILDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER TRIBAL, STATE AND FEDERAL AIR PROFESSIONALS, REVIEWING TITLE V AIR PERMITS AND CONDUCTING EDUCATION AND OUTREACH WITHIN THE COMMUNITY ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES.

THE LITTLE TRAVERSE BAY BANDS OF ODAWA INDIANS (LTBB) SEEKS TO PROTECT AIR QUALITY AND INCREASE TRIBAL ENERGY SOVEREIGNTY ON THE RESERVATION THROUGH: INCREASED REGULATORY CAPACITY ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES; RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF CLIMATE CHANGE MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION STRATEGIES FOR LTBB GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS; PROVIDING INDOOR AIR QUALITY IMPROVEMENT INFORMATION TO TRIBAL CITIZENS; AND INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY ISSUES AND CLIMATE CHANGE MITIGATION AND ADAPTATION STRATEGIES.

LITTLE TRAVERSE BAY BANDS OF ODAWA INDIANS (LTBB) WILL IDENTIFY SOURCES OF AIR POLLUTION AND DETERMINE IMPACTS ON AIR QUALITY IN AND AROUND THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION. ADDITIONALLY, LTBB WILL CONTINUE RESEARCHING TREATMENT AS A STATE UNDER THE TRIBAL AUTHORITY RULE PROCESS, COMMENT ON AIR PERMITS, PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRIBAL CITIZENS ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES, AND CONDUCT EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES.

LITTLE TRAVERSE BAY BAND (LTBB) WILL IDENTIFY SOURCES OF AIR POLLUTION AND DETERMINE IMPACTS ON AIR QUALITY IN AND AROUND THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION. ADDITIONALLY, LTBB WILL CONTINUE RESEARCHING TREATMENT AS A STATE UNDER THE TRIBAL AUTHORITY RULE PROCESS, COMMENT ON AIR PERMITS, PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO TRIBAL CITIZENS ON INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES, AND CONDUCT EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ON AIR QUALITY ISSUES.

DESCRIPTION:THE GOAL OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE GROWING PROGRAMMATIC CAPABILITY TO SERVE AS A RESOURCE FOR THE ST. CROIX COMMUNITIES AND CONTINUE TO BE ACTIVE IN REGION 5 INITIATIVES BY FURTHER DEVELOPING THE TRIBE'S AIR PROGRAM, PROMOTING HEALTHY IAQ, AND EXPANDING EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH TO TRIBAL MEMBER. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL CONFERENCE CALLS, ATTENDING REGIONAL MEETINGS, ASTHMA FORUMS, PERFORMING HOME ASSESSMENTS AND WORKING WITH THE TRIBAL HOUSING DEPARTMENT BY BEING A RESOURCE DURING THE PLANNING PROCESS TO REHABILITATE HOMES, AND PARTICIPATING IN HEALTHY HOME PROGRAMS. ST. CROIX WILL RETAIN AN AIR COORDINATOR WHO WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ON THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED FROM TRAININGS TO BE ACTIVE IN R5 AMBIENT AIR ISSUES. A PORTION OF THE AIR SPECIALISTS TIME WILL BE DEDICATED TO PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL AND TRIBAL AIR QUALITY CONCERNS, THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN CONFERENCE CALLS AND LOCAL MEETINGS, AS WELL AS BRINGING A BASIS OF UNDERSTANDING ON HOW THE ST. CROIX COMMUNITY CAN MODIFY OPERATIONS TO PROMOTE HEALTHIER AIR AND RAISE AIR QUALITY AWARENESS TO THE ST. CROIX MEMBERS.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:FROM THESE ACTIVITIES, ST. CROIX ANTICIPATES ENHANCING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TRIBE'S AIR PROGRAM AND ITS CAPABILITIES, EDUCATING TRIBAL MEMBERS ON AIR ISSUES, IMPROVING TRIBAL HEALTH AS IT RELATES TO AIR QUALITY, AND DEVELOPING METHODS FOR TAKING FUTURE CORRECTIVE ACTIONS FOR COMMON HOUSEHOLD AIR QUALITY ISSUES. THESE DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES WILL BENEFIT THE ST. CROIX TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS.

THE GOAL OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE GROWING PROGRAMMATIC CAPABILITY TO SERVE AS A RESOURCE FOR THE ST. CROIX COMMUNITIES AND CONTINUE TO BE ACTIVE IN REGION 5 INITIATIVES, SUCH AS PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL CONFERENCE CALLS, ATTENDING REGIONAL MEETINGS, ASTHMA FORUMS, PERFORMING HOME ASSESSMENTS AND WORKING WITH THE TRIBAL HOUSING DEPARTMENT BY BEING A RESOURCE DURING THE PLANNING PROCESS TO REHABILITATE HOMES, AND PARTICIPATING IN HEALTHY HOME PROGRAMS.  ST. CROIX WILL RETAIN AN AIR COORDINATOR WHO WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ON THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED FROM TRAININGS TO BE ACTIVE IN R5 AMBIENT AIR ISSUES.  A PORTION OF THE AIR SPECIALISTS TIME WILL BE DEDICATED TO PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL AND TRIBAL AIR QUALITY CONCERNS, THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN CONFERENCE CALLS AND LOCAL MEETINGS, AS WELL AS BRINGING A BASIS OF UNDERSTANDING ON HOW THE ST. CROIX COMMUNITY CAN MODIFY OPERATIONS TO PROMOTE HEALTHIER AIR AND RAISE AIR QUALITY AWARENESS TO THE ST. CROIX MEMBERS.

ST CROIX WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO CHARACTERIZE AND ADDRESS AIR QUALITY CONCERNS ON THEIR RESERVATION.  SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE AIR QUALITY TRAINING, AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND CREATE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AIR QUALITY THROUGH OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.  THE TRIBE WILL BEGIN APPLICATION PROCESS FOR SECTION 105 CLEAN AIR ACT AUTHORITIES AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TO DEVELOP AN ASTHMA PROGRAM.

THE ST CROIX CHIPPEWA INDIAN TRIBE WILL CONDUCT INVESTIGATIONS OF HOMES AND/OR OFFICES FOR INDOOR AIR CONCERNS, SUCH AS MOLD, VENTILATION, AND MOISTURE CONCERNS AS THESE ISSUES ARISE.  THE TRIBE WILL PUBLISH AN ARTICLE IN THE TRIBAL NEWSPAPER EACH SPRING AND FALL TARGETING MOISTURE AND MOLD SOURCES IN HOMES AND BUSINESSES AND PRESENT THEIR FINDINGS TO THE TRIBAL COUNCIL MEMBERS.  THE TRIBE WILL PARTICIPATE IN QUARTERLY CONFERENCE CALLS AND REPRESENT THE TRIBE AT EPA AIR MEETINGS.  THE TRIBE WILL PROVIDE A QUARTERLY AND FINAL REPORT TO EPA.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS FOR THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY TO BUILD CAPACITY TO CHARACTERIZE AND ADDRESS AIR QUALITY CONCERNS ON TRIBAL LANDS.  ACTIVITIES:TRIBAL STAFF WILL COMPLETE AIR QUALITY TRAININGS VIA THE INSTITUTE FOR TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS AND EPA'S AIR KNOWLEDGE CURRICULUM FOR AIR QUALITY PROFESSIONALS.  SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPLETING AIR QUALITY BASELINE ASSESSMENTS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY AND USE OF AIR SENSORS, REVIEWING DRAFT AIR PERMITS FOR SOURCES NEAR TRIBAL LANDS, INCREASING PUBLIC AWARENESS OF AMBIENT AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES THROUGH COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH.  FURTHER, THE TRIBE WILL ASSESS THE NEED FOR AIR MONITORING ON TRIBAL LANDS VIA THE RESULTS OF ITS AIR EMISSIONS INVENTORY PROJECT AND INFORMATION COLLECTED FROM AIR QUALITY SENSORS.      SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE A BASELINE AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENT OF THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY VIA COMPLETION OF AN EMISSIONS INVENTORY, AND TRAINED AIR QUALITY STAFF TO PROVIDE THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY WITH GREATER KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF LOCAL AMBIENT AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY ISSUES.  THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE BAY MILLS INDIAN COMMUNITY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO INITIATE MONITORING OF AIR POLLUTANTS IN AND NEAR THE LOWER SIOUX COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:TRIBAL STAFF WILL COMPLETE AIR QUALITY TRAININGS, EVALUATE EQUIPMENT FOR MONITORING RELEVANT AIR QUALITY CONCERNS, SELECT MONITORING LOCATIONS, AND INSTALL AIR MONITORING EQUIPMENT TO BEGIN AIR QUALITY DATA COLLECTION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE A BASELINE AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENT OF THE LOWER SIOUX COMMUNITY, FOR AN OUTCOME OF GREATER KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF LOCAL AIR QUALITY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE LOWER SIOUX TRIBE AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

THE ONEIDA NATION WILL WORK ON ESTABLISHING CORE CAPACITY TO PROMOTE HEALTHIER INDOOR AIR QUALITY THROUGH INDOOR AIR QUALITY HOME ASSESSMENT TRAINING, DEVELOPING QUALITY ASSURANCE PROTOCOLS FOR DATA COLLECTION, PROVIDING RESOURCES TO DEVELOP ENERGY EFFICIENT AND CLEANER HEATING AND IDENTIFYING WEATHERIZATION PROJECTS.  THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROGRAM ARE THE MEMBERS OF THE ONEIDA NATION.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $45,000 TO THE THE MISSISSIPPI BAND OF CHOCTAW INDIANS TO BUILD CAPACITY FOR ESTABLISHING AN AIR QUALI

DESCRIPTION:INITIAL AWARD.
THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO MONITOR, STUDY, AND RESEARCH AIR QUALITY ON PASSAMAQUODDY INDIAN TOWNSHIP LAND, AND CONDUCT OUTREACH ON ACID RAIN AND HOW IT IMPACTS TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE MONITORING ACID RAIN BY COLLECTING SAMPLES, CONDUCTING QUALITY ASSURANCE ACTIVITIES FOR ACID RAIN DEPOSITION AND RESEARCH, COMPLETING THE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS FOR THE MONITORED DATA, ENSURING QUALITY COLLECTION OF ACID RAIN DATA, PROVIDING OUTREACH TO TRIBAL MEMBERS REGARDING AIR POLLUTION IMPACTS, AND INFORMING LOCAL CITIZENS OF NORTHERN MAINE ABOUT AIR QUALITY.   ACTIVITIES:COLLECTION AND PROCESSING ACID RAIN DATA IS THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY TO BE PERFORMED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS MONITORING OF ACID RAIN AND ASSOCIATED DATA. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE TRIBE AND RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MAINE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE PASSAMAQUODDY TRIBE AT PLEASANT POINT IN THEIR EFFORTS TO DEVELOP AIR POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAMS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE TRIBAL MEMBERS AND LOCAL GENERAL POPULATIONS. THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STATIONARY SOURCE AND OUTDOOR AIR QUALITY MONITORING, EDUCATION ON INDOOR AIR QUALITY, MONITORING FOR OZONE AND PARTICULATE MATTER, AND OPERATING MONITORING NETWORKS THAT COLLECT AIR DATA AND SUBMITTING THEM TO EPA AND THE STATE OF MAINE. ACTIVITIES:THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE RESOURCES FOR YEAR-ROUND OZONE MONITORING AND PM2.5. THESE FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO CONTINUE THE PROGRAM'S METEOROLOGICAL MONITORING EFFORTS. ADDITIONALLY, THESE FUNDS WILL SUPPORT TRIBAL INDOOR AIR QUALITY CAPACITY BUILDING AND RESOURCES, SPECIFICALLY INDOOR AIR QUALITY EDUCATION RESOURCES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND SENSORS TO ASSESS COMMON INDOOR AIR PARAMETERS. LASTLY, THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT TECHNICAL SUPPORT, OUTREACH AND TRAINING IN ORDER TO INCREASE CAPACITY AND KNOWLEDGE REGIONALLY AND NATIONALLY; SHARE INFORMATION TO TRIBAL MEMBERS AND OTHER TRIBAL AIR PROGRAMS; AND IMPROVE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN TRIBAL MEMBERS, POLICY MAKERS, AND END USERS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE COLLECTION OF HOURLY O3 AVERAGES, 1-POINT QCS AND ANNUAL PE AQS DATA SUBMISSIONS. IN ADDITION TO OZONE MONITORING, COLLECTION OF HOURLY PM2.5 VALUES, MONTHLY FLOW CHECK RESULTS AND QUARTERLY AUDIT FLOW CHECKS WILL BE PERFORMED. METEOROLOGICAL DATA WILL ALSO BE POLLED ON AN HOURLY BASIS TO SUPPORT FORECASTING AND MODELING NEEDS. ADDITIONAL DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE REPLACING RH, TEMPERATURE, WIND DIRECTION AND WIND SPEED SENSORS WITH RE-CERTIFIED SENSORS. THE AIR PROGRAM WILL ALSO RESPOND TO AND ASSESS INDOOR AIR QUALITY NEEDS, INCLUDING REQUESTING SENSOR LOANS FROM USEPA REGION 1 IF AVAILABLE. OTHER EXTRANEOUS DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ATTENDING CONFERENCES, TRAININGS AND WORKSHOPS AS NEEDED. 

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE USING THE COLLECTED OZONE AND PM2.5 DATA FOR MODELING AND FORECASTING; BASELINE AND BACKGROUND DATA; AND LONG-TERM MODELING TRENDS. METEOROLOGICAL MONITORING DATA WILL BE USED TO BETTER ASSESS AIR QUALITY AND GROUND TRUTH SATELLITE INFORMATION. INDOOR AIR QUALITY RESOURCES WILL ENHANCE INDOOR AIR QUALITY AWARENESS AND INCREASE INDOOR AIR QUALITY RESOURCE CAPACITY AND KNOWLEDGE. LASTLY, ATTENDING TRAININGS AND WORKSHOPS WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITY FOR INCREASED CAPACITY AND KNOWLEDGE, AS WELL AS INFORMATION SHARING BETWEEN TRIBAL AIR PROGRAMS.

THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THESE ACTIVITIES ARE COMMUNITY RESIDENTS WHO WILL HAVE GREATER AWARENESS OF OUTDOOR AND INDOOR AIR QUALITY, AND DECREASED RISK OF ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS INCLUDING CANCER, ASTHMA AND NEUROLOGICAL EFFECTS.
